Description: Body fragment of black-figured pottery open vase, with strong vertical curvature, perhaps lekanis; inside glazed; slipped on the exterior, black above, with added red band, and small section of frieze below, part of a rosette with incised central circles, and uncertain remains left and right. The paint is fired to dark reddish-brown (2.5 YR 3/4).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 58, no. 206 pl. 48)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GS.289)
